  • Constructor Details

    • BoardViewController

      public BoardViewController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes various boolean flags and variables for the controller.

      This method initializes several boolean flags and variables used to track different states and selections within the controller. It sets test, cardSelected, cardDrawn, cardPlaced, side, buttonCardSelectedId, angleChosen, and numTurns to their initial states or values. This method is typically called during the initialization phase of the controller.

    • setUpBoard

      public void setUpBoard()
      Sets up the game board interface with initial components and data.

      This method initializes and configures various UI elements on the game board, including player recap containers, hand display, starter card placement, objective loading, and initial deck setup. It prepares the board for gameplay by populating it with necessary components and displaying initial game state information.

      Specifically, it does the following:

      • Sets up a container for player recap information.
      • Loads the player's initial hand.
      • Places the player's chosen starter card on the board.
      • Loads and displays the player's secret and common objectives.
      • Initializes and displays initial decks of resource and gold cards.
      • Displays a message indicating waiting status for other players.
      • Shows a loading icon or indicator.

      This method is typically called when initializing the game board UI to set up its initial state.

    • setPlayersRecapVbox

      public void setPlayersRecapVbox(javafx.scene.layout.VBox playersRecapVbox)
      Sets up the player recap display within the specified VBox.

      This method initializes and configures UI elements for displaying player-specific information, including resource counts, points, and player icons. It sets up individual rows for each player, populating them with labels and icons that reflect the current state of the game for each player.

      The recap display includes:

      • Player identification and associated pawn icon.
      • Resource counts for animals, insects, fungi, plants, quills, manuscripts, and inkwells.
      • Total points accumulated by each player.

      The method ensures that the player's own recap is displayed in a special layout, while other players' recaps are displayed differently, including buttons to view their codex.

      This method is typically called during the initialization of the game board UI to set up and display player-specific information in a recap format.

      Parameters:
      playersRecapVbox - The VBox container where the player recap information will be displayed.

    • placeCard

      public void placeCard(CardGame cardToPlace, Integer[] position)
      Displays a specified card on the game board grid at the given position.

      This method adds an ImageView of the specified card to the GridPane of the game board, positioning it according to the provided coordinates. The method checks whether the card is front-facing or back-facing and retrieves the appropriate image to display.

      If the card is front-facing, its front cover image is displayed; otherwise, its back cover image is used.

      The displayed card image is sized to fit within the specified dimensions (83x120 pixels).

      Additionally, this method adjusts the scroll pane's horizontal and vertical values to center the view on the newly placed card within the grid.

      Parameters:
      cardToPlace - The card object to be displayed on the game board.
      position - An array containing the x and y coordinates where the card should be placed in the grid.

    • updateDecks

      public void updateDecks(List<Card> updatedDecks)
      Updates the display of decks on the game board with the provided list of cards.

      This method updates the UI representation of various decks with the images of the cards provided in the updatedDecks list. It sets the images for both front and back covers of the resource and gold decks, as well as the action handlers and styles for buttons associated with each deck.

      The method retrieves specific card images from the updated decks list and assigns them to corresponding ImageViews for display on the game board UI. It also configures event handlers for each button associated with the decks to show error pop-ups and apply visual effects when hovered over.

      Specified by:
      updateDecks in interface UserInterfaceStrategy
      Overrides:
      updateDecks in class GUI
      Parameters:
      updatedDecks - A list of Card objects containing updated information for the game's resource and gold decks.

    • setFullScreen

      public void setFullScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggles the full-screen mode of the application window associated with the given ActionEvent.

      If the window is currently in full-screen mode, it switches to normal window mode and updates the screen icon image to indicate full-screen availability. If the window is not in full-screen mode, it sets the window to full-screen mode and updates the screen icon image to indicate minimizing screen.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent triggering the method call, used to obtain the source node's window.

    • setSide

      public void setSide(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggles the display between the front and back sides of three cards in the user interface. If the button's current text is "view back side", it switches the cards to display their back sides and updates the button text to "view front side". If the button's current text is "view front side", it switches the cards to display their front sides and updates the button text to "view back side".
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent triggering the method call, typically fired by a button click.

    • viewScoreboard

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent triggering the method call, usually from a button click.

      angles - List of Coordinates representing available positions and angles.

    • matrixUpdated

      public void matrixUpdated(List<Integer[]> tempButtons, Integer[] positionToPlaceCard)
      Updates the game grid after placing a card, removes temporary buttons, and updates the card images.
      Parameters:
      tempButtons - List of temporary buttons to remove from the grid.
      positionToPlaceCard - Position on the grid where the card is placed.

    • drawFromDecks

      public void drawFromDecks()
      Allows the player to select a card to draw from available decks. Updates the GUI and sends the chosen card information to the client.

    • updatePlayerstate

      public void updatePlayerstate(String userTarget)

      Parameters:
      userTarget - The username of the player whose state is to be updated.

    • updateMyPlayerstate

      public void updateMyPlayerstate()
      Updates the UI elements displaying the player's own state (resources and score). Retrieves information from the ViewModel associated with the current user's username.

    • viewChat

      public void viewChat(javafx.stage.Stage chatStage) throws IOException
      Opens a new chat window as a modal dialog on top of the specified Stage.
      Parameters:
      chatStage - The Stage on which the chat window is based.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the Chat.fxml file.

    • updateChat

      public void updateChat(Message message)
      Updates the chat interface with the given message. If the chat window is open, the message is passed to the chatController to update the chat display. If the chat window is closed, it updates the iconChat with a notification icon.
      Parameters:
      message - The Message object to be displayed in the chat interface.

    • viewOpponentsCodex

      public void viewOpponentsCodex(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Opens a popup window to display the codex of opponents based on the action event triggered by a button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking a button to view opponents' codex.

    • endGameRanking

      public void endGameRanking(List<javafx.util.Pair<String,Integer>> ranking)
      Displays the end game ranking and handles UI cleanup and closure after a specified delay. Clears the centerBoardContainer, constructs a VBox to display game results or waiting message, and sets up a timer to close the GUI after 5 seconds.
      Parameters:
      ranking - The list of pairs containing player names and their scores, or null if a player left the game.

    • closeGui

      public void closeGui()
      Closes the current GUI window associated with the application. Retrieves the Stage of the current window using a control element (buttonDeckGBack in this case), and closes the Stage to terminate the application.

    • exitFromGame

      public void exitFromGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Initiates the process to exit the current game session. Sends an exit game message to the server, cancels any active timers, and closes the GUI window associated with the game.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event that triggers the exit from the game.
